dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.welcomeDesc: Get started by installing ComfyUI on your machine.

models.title: Models
models.directoriesDesc: Directories shared across all installs. The first directory is the primary (default for ComfyUI).

common.name: Name
common.portConflictAuto: Use next available port (asks if --port is set)

list.title: Installs
list.emptyHint: Install or track an existing version of ComfyUI.

quickInstall.title: Install ComfyUI
quickInstall.desc: We'll install the latest version of ComfyUI. Please confirm your GPU type below.

newInstall.title: New Install
newInstall.nvidiaDriverWarning: Your NVIDIA driver ({driverVersion}) may be too old for the bundled PyTorch. Recommended minimum: {minimumVersion}. Please consider updating your NVIDIA drivers if you run into issues.

diskSpace.warningMessage: The target drive only has {free} free. This operation may require approximately {required}. You may run out of space during the process.
diskSpace.warningMessageGeneric: The target drive only has {free} free. You may run out of space during the process.

pathValidation.insideAppBundleMessage: This path is inside the Launcher's application directory. Files here will be deleted when the Launcher is updated. Please choose a different location.
pathValidation.oneDriveMessage: This path is inside OneDrive. Cloud sync can cause performance issues and file corruption with large Python environments. Please choose a location outside OneDrive.
pathValidation.insideSharedDirMessage: This path is inside a shared models, input, or output directory. Installing here can corrupt shared data. Please choose a different location.
pathValidation.insideExistingInstallMessage: This path overlaps with an existing installation. Installing here can cause conflicts and data corruption. Please choose a different location.

trackCards.noInfo: Select this track and check for updates to see version info.

settings.title: Settings
settings.closeQuitMessage: ComfyUI instances are still running. Quitting will stop all of them.

actions.featureNotImplemented: This feature is not yet implemented.
actions.copyInstallationMessage: Enter a name for the copy. It will be created next to the original.
actions.deleteConfirmMessage: This will permanently delete the install and all its files. This cannot be undone.
actions.untrackConfirmMessage: This will remove the install from the launcher. The files will not be deleted.

migrate.selectSourceMessage: Select a source install to migrate from.
migrate.confirmMessage:
Select what to migrate from the source install.

Custom nodes are copied additively (existing nodes backed up). Models, input, and output use flat merge (existing files are skipped).
migrate.noInstallations: No other installs available to migrate from.
migrate.noComfyUIDir: Source install has no ComfyUI directory.
migrate.noUvOrPython: ⚠ Cannot install dependencies: uv or Python environment not found.

git.label: Git Source
git.desc: Clone from a Git repository for development or custom forks.

remote.label: Remote Connection
remote.desc: Connect to a running ComfyUI instance on another machine.

cloud.label: Cloud
cloud.desc: Connect to Comfy Cloud for remote GPU-powered workflows.

standalone._note: standalone.label and portable.label are product names — keep in English across all translations.
standalone.label: Standalone
standalone.desc: Pre-built environment with managed Python and dependencies.
standalone.newEnvMessage: Enter a name for the new environment.
standalone.cannotDeleteActive: Cannot delete the active environment. Set another environment as active first.
standalone.deleteEnvConfirmMessage: Delete environment "{env}"? This cannot be undone.
standalone.cleanupEnvStatus: Removing redundant packages from template environment…
standalone.trackStableDesc: Tested releases, recommended for most users
standalone.trackLatestDesc: Newest commits from the master branch
standalone.updateConfirmMessage:
Update from {installed} to {latest}?

Local changes will be stashed and a backup branch created.

Release notes:
{notes}
standalone.updateConfirmMessageDowngrade:
Roll back from {installed} to stable release {latest}?

Your install is currently ahead of the latest stable release. This will check out the stable tag, removing any newer commits. Local changes will be stashed and a backup branch created.

Release notes:
{notes}
standalone.updateFailed: Update process failed with exit code {code}.
standalone.updateNoGit: No .git directory found in ComfyUI/. Commit-based updating requires a git repository.
standalone.copyAndUpdateMessage:
Create a copy of this install and update the copy from {installed} to {latest}.
The original install will not be modified.

Enter a name for the copy:
standalone.releaseUpdateSelectReleaseMessage: Choose a Standalone release to install.
standalone.releaseUpdateSelectVariantMessage: Choose an environment variant for the new install.
standalone.releaseUpdateNameMessage: Enter a name for the new install. It will be created next to the original.
standalone.snapshotHistoryEmpty: No snapshots yet. Snapshots are captured automatically when ComfyUI starts.
standalone.snapshotSaveMessage: Save a snapshot of the current environment state. Optionally provide a label.
standalone.snapshotDeleteMessage: Delete this snapshot? This cannot be undone.

portable.label: Portable
portable.desc: Official portable Windows builds with embedded Python.
portable.trackStableDesc: Tested releases, recommended for most users
portable.trackLatestDesc: Newest commits from the master branch
portable.updateConfirmMessage:
Update from {installed} to {latest}?

Local changes will be stashed and a backup branch created.

Release notes:
{notes}
portable.updateFailed: Update process failed with exit code {code}.
portable.noUpdateDir: No update directory found in this portable install.

launch.waiting: Waiting for ComfyUI to be ready…
launch.waitingTime: Waiting for ComfyUI to be ready… ({secs}s)
launch.portBusyUsing: Port {old} is busy — using port {new} instead…
launch.instanceRunningMessage: "{name}" is currently running. Running multiple local installs simultaneously may use significant system resources.

errors.noLaunchSupport: This source does not support launching yet.
errors.noEnvFound: Cannot launch: no Python environment found. Create one first.
errors.alreadyRunning: ComfyUI is already running. Stop it before launching again.
errors.installDirEmpty: Install folder is missing or empty. Delete this install and reinstall.
errors.installNotReady: This install is not ready to launch. It may still be installing or may have failed.
errors.cannotConnect: Could not connect to {url}. Make sure ComfyUI is running at that address.
errors.portConflictLauncher: Port {port} is already in use by "{name}", launched from another ComfyUI Launcher instance. Stop it first or change the port in Startup Arguments.
errors.portConflictComfy: Port {port} is already in use by {process}, which appears to be a ComfyUI instance. Stop it first or change the port in Startup Arguments.
errors.portConflictOther: Port {port} is already in use by {process}. Change the port in Startup Arguments to avoid conflicts.
errors.portConflictKillConfirmMessage: This will forcefully stop the process currently using this port. Any unsaved work in that ComfyUI instance will be lost.
errors.portConflictKillFailed: Could not free port {port}. The process may require manual termination.
errors.duplicateName: An install named "{name}" already exists. Please choose a different name.
